name: Plastic Bottle
tips_3r: Reduce single-use plastics; reuse bottles before recycling.
disposal_tips: Rinse thoroughly to remove residue. Flatten the bottle. Place in the plastics recycling bin.
toxicity: Releases microplastics if burned or degraded
legal_restrictions: EU mandates recycling of PET bottles by 2025
breakdown_process: Breaks down into microplastics that persist in oceans
handling_precautions: Avoid burning, as it releases toxic fumes

name: Banana Peel
tips_3r: Compost fruit and vegetable scraps to create natural fertilizer.
disposal_tips: Add directly to your compost pile or community compost bin.
legal_restrictions: None, but not suitable for regular recycling bins
reuse_ideas: Shine leather shoes with inside of peel
breakdown_process: Decomposes naturally into compost and nutrients for soil
handling_precautions: Avoid leaving peels outdoors, they attract pests

name: Aluminum Can
tips_3r: Recycle aluminum cans; they can be recycled infinitely without losing quality.
disposal_tips: Rinse the can, crush it to save space, and place it in the recycling bin.
carbon_footprint: 1.5 kg CO₂ per kg aluminum produced
toxicity: None in solid state, but harmful if burned
legal_restrictions: Many regions mandate deposit-return schemes for cans
breakdown_process: Oxidizes slowly but recyclable endlessly without quality loss
handling_precautions: Be careful of sharp edges after opening

name: Battery
tips_3r: Use rechargeable batteries to reduce waste.
disposal_tips: Take to a battery recycling drop-off point; never throw in trash.
carbon_footprint: 1.5 kg CO₂ per 4 AA batteries produced
toxicity: Releases lead, mercury, and cadmium into soil and water
legal_restrictions: EU bans disposal of batteries in general waste
breakdown_process: Leaches toxic metals into soil and groundwater
handling_precautions: Wear gloves; avoid contact with leaking batteries

name: Old Mobile Phone
tips_3r: Donate or trade in old phones before recycling.
disposal_tips: Drop off at an e-waste recycling facility or electronics store collection point.
toxicity: Contains lead, cadmium, arsenic, and flame retardants
legal_restrictions: Many countries have mandatory e-waste recycling laws
reuse_ideas: Turn into a home security camera
breakdown_process: Slow breakdown; toxic chemicals leach into environment
handling_precautions: Do not incinerate; remove battery before recycling
